metadata.synopsis: A young man (Noah Taylor) lives with numerous bizarre roommates while jumping from place to place.

reviews: [Lowenstein] balances the needs of the comedic pain with the exigencies of dramatic truth very well.
the pop philosophy may sound like Richard Linklater material, but director Richard Lowenstein veers his scenarios with more control
Those who like their cinema on the edge should find a lot to enjoy here.
Noah Taylor acts as our bemused tour guide who leads the audience through a rather restrained freak show.
Lowenstein's misplaced faith in his own scriptwriting abilities results in an overblown, sprawling mess.
